resources.string: No included dictionaries found.\n\nClick here to download one.
No recently loaded dictionaries found.\n\nClick here to download one.

Downloading a dictionary involves 4 steps (the following assumes you have a file manager like Astro installed):

1.Choose and download a dictionary on the website that is opened after confirming this dialog. Note: Only dictionaries of version 2.4.4 or higher are supported.

2.Extract the zip-file's content to a directory on your SD-card (e.g. using Astro).

3.Optional: Extract the included jar-archive's content onto your SD-card for faster look-ups.

4.Select the dictionary in the previously shown dialog.

Alternatively, you could download and extract the dictionary using your PC, then transfer the files to your sd-card.
Dictionary was not found.\n\nPlease select a dictionary using the following dialog.
Selected item does not look like a dictionary.

Looks like you are running this program for the first time! Please select a dictionary using the following screen.

Translation was canceled after a timeout.\nYou could speed up translation by extracting the archived dictionary to a folder on your SD-card and choosing this folder as dictionary. Alternatively you can increase the timeout in the preferences dialog.
The selected archive could not be loaded, but seems to include a compressed dictionary. Please extract the included jar-file first.

Use wildcard characters to refine your search:
%1$c matches any series of characters
%2$c matches any single character

To control sub-expression search:
%3$c as the first character produces results starting with your search-entry
%4$c after your entry produces results ending with it.

Please note: Adding wildcard characters overrides search mode preferences.
DictionaryForMIDs is a free multi-language dictionary for cell phones and PDAs
